body: Every time you shut down android studio, a dart.exe process (Flutter Daemon) remains in the system. After multiple operations, there will be many flutterer daemons running in the background.

@qicrosoft How do you shut down Android Studio?

Its the same problem on Linux for me using IntelliJ IDEA 2022.1 .
One dart process per IDE exit stays alive forever it seems.
My solution is that i manually do kill -9 on the leftover dart process :(

I have tested with both latest stable, and now master flutter:
$ flutter doctor -v
[‚úì] Flutter (Channel master, 3.1.0-0.0.pre.964, on Manjaro Linux 5.18.0-1-MANJARO, locale en_US.UTF-8)

> @qicrosoft How do you shut down Android Studio?

Create a new or open flutter project, the task manager will appear several dart .exe processes, write code normally or do nothing, directly turn off Android Studio, a process with daemon parameters will not end, no matter how long it will not end.

> This looks like a bug in Android Studio Chipmunk. I can reproduce it with Chipmunk but not with Bumblebee.
> 
> @qicrosoft How do you determine which dart.exe does not exit? There are two, and one does exit, but I couldn't find anything saying the one left behind was the Flutter daemon, and not the Dart analyzer.
> 
> Using Bumblebee, I could see in the Task Manager that one dart.exe exited immediately, but the other took a few seconds to go away.

With Windows Task Manager I can see the dart.exe process contains the "daemon" option. This process will never exit, no matter how long it takes. Could it be due to China's network problems? But Visual Studio Code doesn't have that problem.

title: Flutter daemon keep runing after android studio ide close (On Windows 10)
